title: The real reason for brains
description: Neuroscientist Daniel Wolpert starts from a surprising premise: the brain evolved, not to think or feel, but to control movement. In this entertaining, data-rich talk he gives us a glimpse into how the brain creates the grace and agility of human motion.
author: Daniel Wolpert
keywords: TED, talks, biology, brain, evolution, science, math, biomechanics, AI, engineering, robots, neuroscience, decision-making, consciousness, cognitive science
